Set (replace) STICS input file parameters

Source: R/set_param_txt.R
set_param_txt.Rd

Replace or set an input parameter from a pre-existing STICS input file.

set_param_txt(dirpath = getwd(), param, value, add = F, plant = 1)

set_usm_txt(filepath = "new_travail.usm", param, value, add = F)

set_station_txt(filepath = "station.txt", param, value, add = F)

set_ini_txt(filepath = "ficini.txt", param, value, add = F)

set_general_txt(filepath = "tempopar.sti", param, value, add = F)

set_tmp_txt(filepath = "tempoparv6.sti", param, value, add = F)

set_plant_txt(filepath = "ficplt1.txt", param, value, add = F, variety = NULL)

set_tec_txt(filepath = "fictec1.txt", param, value, add = F)

set_soil_txt(filepath = "param.sol", param, value)

set_out_var_txt(filepath = "var.mod", vars = c("lai(n)", "masec(n)"), add = F)

Arguments

dirpath

USM directory path
param

Parameter name
value

New parameter value
add

Boolean. Append input to existing file (add to the list)
plant

Plant index. Optional, only for plant or technical parameters
filepath

Path to the parameter file
variety

Integer. The plant variety to get the parameter from.
vars

Vector of variable names for STICS output requirements

Details

The plant parameter can be either equal to 1, 2 for the associated plant in the case of intercrop, or c(1,2) for both Princiapl and associated plants. all_out_var is a helper function that returns all possible output variables.

Note

set_out_var_txt is not used by set_param_txt. To replace the output variables required from STICS, please directly call set_out_var_txt.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# Replace the interrow distance parameter to 0.01:

library(SticsRFiles)
set_param_txt(dirpath = "stics_usm/usm_1", param= "interrang", value= 0.01)

}
